comments.author: b
comments.content:
I always enjoyed reading Paul Graham's essays because his philosophy is often in tune with what you're saying. It could be drastically simplified to: "build it and they will come ...and buy." When I look back at the lines you wrote I was doing something that people I knew depended on. By doing my job I could make their lives better., I feel you'd be able to say the same if the company was yours (assuming your company isn't manufacturing lead-based pacifiers). It's all about identifying what you want to build, then delivering.

The only major difference is that as the fearless oni leader of the company, you are actually able to decide what. Your typical salaryman may build, but may not decide.
